Speaker: shooting script
Dialogue: Revised Third Draft March 30, 1983 Becherman/Canton-Richter

Speaker: narrator
Dialogue: The advent of the Soviet nuclear capability ushers in a dangerous phase of the Cold War as the decade of the 1950s looms.  Stung by this Soviet challenge and the rapid race to develop ever more sophisticated weapons, the United States resurrects maverick Professor Toichi Hikita's work in electromagnetic particle acceleration...despite the dismal record of failure that has dogged the project.

Speaker: narrator
Dialogue: Doctor Masado Banzai, preeminent Japanese quantum theorist, declares himself anxious to work for the Allies.  Enamored of the great American West, Banzai sires a precocious son and tags the tiny child "Buckaroo." A tribute to his adopted homeland.

Speaker: narrator
Dialogue: And thus given a second chance after his secret pre-war laboratory disaster at Princeton, Doctor Hikita finds new life at the Texas School of Mines, where he assembles a team of crack scientists willing to gamble he's right in his bold assertion that man can indeed pass unharmed through solid matter.

Speaker: narrator
Dialogue: Sir Alan Motley of Cambridge, a brainy, affable limey, co-developer with Whitehead and Lord Russell of the world's most advanced theoretical gravity catapult...

Speaker: narrator
Dialogue: Dr. Sandra Banzai, Texas-born pioneer in Negative Mass Propulsion ...wife of Dr. Masado Banzai.

Speaker: today
Dialogue: THIRTY YEARS LATER

Speaker: general catburd
Dialogue: You're kidding. Where is he?  Still in the hospital?

Speaker: general catburd
Dialogue: Banzai hasn't showed yet, Mr. Secretary. Looks like he's got cold feet.

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: Better see what's keepin' the boss, Reno.

Speaker: reno
Dialogue: Why me?

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: 'Cause I'm busy.  And get your clodhoppers off the UNIVAC.

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: Rawhide, it's for you.

Speaker: rawhide
Dialogue: I'll ask him.  Buckaroo, I need an estimate.  They're getting antsy over at Mission Control.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Another ten minutes down here, Rawhide.

Speaker: rawhide
Dialogue: The chief needs ten more minutes.  I got the chopper waiting.  Don't start without us.

Speaker: tv anchorwoman
Dialogue: So where's Buckaroo?

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: Whadda you need Buckaroo for?

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: Unscheduled surgery.  He'll be waltzing along momentarily.  What're you doing tonight?

Speaker: tv anchorwoman
Dialogue: Flying to Cambodia.

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: That's why I wear a fifty dollar hat.  Was a two hundred dollar hat, I hadda kill you.

Speaker: tv anchorwoman
Dialogue: Bet you say that to all the girls, Perfect Tommy.

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: Bet I do.

Speaker: star surgeon
Dialogue: Jesus Christ...how does the man find enough hours in the day?

Speaker: rawhide
Dialogue: We help.

Speaker: rawhide
Dialogue: Dr. Banzai's using a laser to fuse artificial nerve fiber to the original, bypassing massive stroke damage.  A subcutaneous microphone's gonna allow the patient to transmit verbal instructions to his own brain.

Speaker: star surgeon
Dialogue: What, like "raise my left arm"?

Speaker: rawhide
Dialogue: Or "throw the harpoon," depending on cultural differences. People are gonna come from all over. This guy's an Eskimo.

Speaker: jewish physician
Dialogue: Okay...right...okay, I see...next time I'll be able to...

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: There may not be a next time.

Speaker: jewish physician
Dialogue: Look...I'm sorry...calling for help in the middle of an operation...but I just lost my nerve...I panicked...again.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: You've got the God-given tools to be a success in any field of endeavor, Dr. Zwibel.  Ever thought about joining me full-time?

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Can you sing?

Speaker: mission control
Dialogue: All systems righteous.  Professor Hikita says we have to go.

Speaker: general catburd
Dialogue: I've got a budget meeting on the hill, John.  What's this thing supposed to do anyway?

Speaker: senator cunningham
Dialogue: Three hundred miles an hour, General.

Speaker: general catburd
Dialogue: Senator, you are so fulla shit.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Final contact is made.

Speaker: general catburd
Dialogue: Too bad war ain't Indianapolis.  It's fast, I'll give Banzai that.

Speaker: senator cunningham
Dialogue: Perhaps an idea whose time has come, General?  Scoot over.

Speaker: general catburd
Dialogue: It'll never work.  It's too simple.

Speaker: tv anchorwoman
Dialogue: Now twenty seconds downrange...Perfect Tommy, how on earth is Buckaroo able to keep that thing on the ground?

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: She's just a damn road hugger, Allison.  Plus the man can drive.

Speaker: general catburd
Dialogue: So what?  Big deal.  Anybody can drive fast in a straight line.

Speaker: mission control
Dialogue: Advise you abort.  Over.  Repeat: advise abort.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: That's a big "no can do".

Speaker: tv anchorwoman
Dialogue: The Jet Car off the road!  Radio contact with Mission Control here severed...that firestorm apparently interfering with communications...Buckaroo Banzai in serious trouble.

Speaker: general catburd
Dialogue: Either that or he's popped his cookies.

Speaker: mission control
Dialogue: Eject, Buckaroo! EJECT!

Speaker: senator cunningham
Dialogue: Professor Hikita, what'd he say?

Speaker: general catburd
Dialogue: Looks like Banzai's finally gonna get more than he bargained for.  And take the friends of the Earth with him.

Speaker: mission control
Dialogue: It's off my scope!

Speaker: general catburd
Dialogue: What the devil?  What is going on?!

Speaker: helicopter newsman
Dialogue: He's through it!  He's gone through the mountain without a scratch! Oh, my God!  Oh, my God in Heaven!

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Chute negative.  I'm gonna try and lay her sideways.

Speaker: general catburd
Dialogue: This his frequency?  Nobody's home.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: See 'em?  They about had me and the whole damn car for breakfast. Broke my windshield...

Speaker: general catburd
Dialogue: Creatures?  Buckaroo, Catburd here.  I got egg all over my face, but that's okay. No room for egos here.  We're all Americans and I wanna buy that thing of yours.  What's it gonna run me?

Speaker: general catburd
Dialogue: I wasn't talking to you, Hikita san.

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: She's not for sale, right, General?

Speaker: doctor lizardo
Dialogue: The Overthruster! The Overthruster!

Speaker: doctor lizardo
Dialogue: The Overthruster!

Speaker: doctor lizardo
Dialogue: More!  More!

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Cheer up, Lizardo, it's Friday.  I come for your TV.  You been using too damn much juice...ten thousand kilowatts again this month.  Beats me how one old homicidal loony could use that much power.

Speaker: doctor lizardo
Dialogue: I want my TV...don't take my TV...I want it.  I want the Overthruster. I want it.

Speaker: rawhide
Dialogue: Five...four...three...two...one.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: I'm starving...somebody, help.

Speaker: rawhide
Dialogue: Got a half a tuna sandwich.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Same one you had yesterday?

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Smells fermented.  Check in with the Institute, Reno, see if everything's kosher.

Speaker: reno
Dialogue: And there's a two-hundred-dollar deductible we have to eat on that crack in her windshield.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Figures.  Anybody seen my scope?

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: Coming right up, Buckaroo.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Anybody we know?

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: Who put this dirty picture in Buckaroo's viewer?

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: Super performance organic material.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Too closely.  Gotta be more than sheer coincidence.  Rawhide, you're keen on bugs.  What do you think?

Speaker: reno
Dialogue: Everything's copacetic at the Institute, Buckaroo.  Sam's with the Jet Car and she's under lock and key.  He's retiming her valves.

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: Buckaroo, you got a minute--?

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Not really.  This is pretty important.

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: She wants a picture.

Speaker: artie duncan
Dialogue: I don't care who you are...when you play my joint, you're just another band. I want some music outta you characters.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Everybody ready?  How do we look?  Do we look okay?

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: I look great.  Let's rock 'n' roll.

Speaker: rawhide
Dialogue: No question about it.  Something very akin to arachnoid tissue.  If I hadda guess?  A mutated species.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: I heard somebody crying.  I said is someone out there crying in the darkness?

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: Here...here at the back. I'm sorry...

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Raise your hand...where?

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: This is so embarrassing...

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Somebody get her a mike? Can we manage that?  And a spotlight.  What's your name?

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: Penny.  I'd rather not reveal my last name or my age.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Did you say..."Peggy"?

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: My name is Penny. Penny Priddy.  There I've said it, but it won't mean anything to you.  I'm a nobody.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Nobody's a nobody.  Why're you crying?  What's wrong?

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: Did I say anything was wrong? I just sponged up a little too much Vat 69, okay? I'm down to my last nickel in this lousy town, I can't get my luggage outta hock 'cause I met this jerk who said he was a record producer when all he had was a record.  He offered to set me up for life, and like a fool, well, I...

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: He offered you money?

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: Do I look like that kinda girl?  I lost my room this morning.  I don't know where I'm gonna sleep tonight, but I keep going.  What the hell else can I do?  I've still got my figure, and like this bozo said, as long as there's a sidewalk, I'll always have a job.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Remember it's always darkest just before the dawn.  Believe me, I've been there.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: This song's for Peggy.  And all you others out there a little down on your luck.

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: My name's, Penny!  But who cares?

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: Let me go, let me go, you creeps...

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Everybody okay up here?

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Where do you think you're going, doc? The moon?

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: Pick those up, Reno.

Speaker: reno
Dialogue: I didn't drop 'em.

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: It's a spittin' image.

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: Pictures don't lie.

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: It's Peggy to these eyes.  Same nose, same hair.  Plus Buckaroo thinks so too or else he wouldn't be ready to go make a fool of himself, right?

Speaker: rawhide
Dialogue: Hot off the World Watch Wire, Buckaroo. Thought you'd wanna be notified. That old pal of the professor's, Dr. Emilio Lizardo?  The one you did the brain scan on--?  He killed a guard last night, broke outta the Trenton Home for the Criminally Insane, stole a Masarati, totaled it a block away.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Then what?

Speaker: rawhide
Dialogue: Vanished. Thin air.

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: Doctor Lizardo. Wasn't he on TV once?

Speaker: reno
Dialogue: You're thinking of Mr. Wizard.  This guy's an eccentric genius.

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: Hey, so was Mr. Wizard.

Speaker: rawhide
Dialogue: Dr. Lizardo's a raving lunatic, Perfect Tommy, a vicious psychopath with crazy eyes and flaming orange hair that once upon a time was mousy brown like yours.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Have you warned Professor Hikita?

Speaker: rawhide
Dialogue: First thing I did.

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: Why?  What's going on?  Anything I oughta know?  C'mon, Rawhide, spill it.

Speaker: rawhide
Dialogue: The professor and Dr. Emilio Lizardo were actually the first to discover the Eighth Dimension.  Almost fifty years ago.  Before Buckaroo's parents even knew each other.  But there was trouble, a rocket catapult failed and Dr. Lizardo got sucked half in, half out...when they hauled him back ,he wasn't the same guy.  His hair was orange...

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: And his soul black as the Ace of Spades.

Speaker: rawhide
Dialogue: He went on a senseless crime spree, killed a cop during a bank robbery, got caught and judged insane.  The professor told us they threw away the key.

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: Hey, any lock can be picked.  So what's he up to?

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: I'm sure we'll find out soon enough.

Speaker: rawhide
Dialogue: And another thing.  Somebody took five bucks outta petty cash without signing.

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: Wasn't me.  I'd take a hundred, right?

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Doubt it.  Check NORAD command.  Could be a volcanic ash cloud.  Work her up statistically, check it for the next twenty-four hours, then shovel the data over to Reno.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Sid, welcome aboard.  Fellas, meet a medical colleague, Sid Zwibel.  He'll be riding with us from now on, so get acquainted while I snoop around.

Speaker: reno
Dialogue: The name's Reno.  This here's Perfect Tommy.

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: Where do you hail from, Doc?

Speaker: reno nevada
Dialogue: Where's your spurs at?

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: Reno, how's about you take New Jersey's gear, mosey on over to the bus and introduce him to the rest of the hands.

Speaker: reno
Dialogue: Why me?

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: Cause Buckaroo needs me here.

Speaker: reno
Dialogue: Follow me, pard'ner.

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: What're you doing here? Why're you looking at me like that?

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: I guess 'cause you remind me of someone I once knew, long ago before any of this craziness.

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: Go away.  Let me rot?

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Who were you really trying to kill last night?

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: You.  Like the papers all say.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Pretty terrible shot.

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: Was she pretty?

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Who?

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: The girl I remind you of.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: She was the Queen of the Netherlands.

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: It's kinda hard this way.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: I'd turn around, but I'm afraid you'd strangle me.

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: The Netherlands.  Whew, that's a long way from Wyoming.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Wyoming? Not Cody, by any chance?

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: No.  Laramie.  Except I was born in Cody. How did you know that?  Oh, right, sure, I forgot: you know everything.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: No, I don't.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Having a little trouble with that knot, aren't you?

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: Which?  The one in my throat.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Did you have family there--? A sister?  In Cody?

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: I don't know. I always felt like I did, like there was another me...

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Another 'you'?

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: Somewhere.  See I was taken away by the Priddies when I was a baby.  I was adopted.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Adopted.  I should have know. Of course. If it was a snake, it'd bit me!

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: What?  I don't understand you.  I don't understand anything anymore.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Who does?  It's a crazy mixed-up world.  Just do the best you can with what you have...

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: Running a little late, Buckaroo.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Let her out. In my custody.

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: Let her out?  She's a killer.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: No she's not.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: I'm assigning a couple Blue Shields to protect you around the clock, just in case.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Mr. Secretary...Senator Cunningham, ladies and gentlemen...thirty years ago, nearly to this day, my mother and father and Sir Alan Motley, all former colleagues of Professor Toichi Hikita at the Texas School of Mines, gave their lives for what was considered at the time an insane notion: the possibility of contacting alien life... not on another planet, but on a simultaneous plane of existence within solid matter...life which, before the war, Professor Hikita had actually glimpsed while pioneering a highly primitive gravity catapult with Doctor Emilio Lizardo.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: I don't wanna go get too technical here, ladies and gentlemen, but I'm talking twister physics.  Quantum Mechanics.  Now you see, now you don't.  This table I'm sitting behind?  It appears to be solid matter, right?

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: But in point of fact, the solid parts of this table... the protons, quarks, your neutrons and electrons...they comprise only about one quadrillionth of its total volume.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Exactly.  So the professor here, way back in 1937, figured that if solid matter is mostly empty space, a person oughta be able to discover a to travel inside things like tables.  And mountains.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Which we all know are the forces that tend to pull objects part, right, professor?

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: Hey, better there than here, huh?

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: The president of what?

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Is he still delirious?

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: Buckaroo, don't forget your thruster.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: You keep an eye on it.

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: Any time.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Mr. President--?  Some kind of interference...I can't...

Speaker: rawhide
Dialogue: Maybe it's just a prankster. Some computer whiz kid.

Speaker: reno
Dialogue: Whoever it was they used the Blue Code, Alpha Clearance.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Go back to the bus and reroute the call.

Speaker: rawhide
Dialogue: And try the President's private number at the hospital.  Make sure this is on the level. We're busy people here.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Pencil!  Quick!  Pen!  Anything!

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: I don't guess they matter.  It's like cheesecloth, I think.  Minkowiski space...

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: There!  Those two!  Don't panic...

Speaker: reno
Dialogue: Whadda you mean, Buckaroo?  Where?  What?

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Evil...pure and simple, from the eighth dimension! Grab 'em!

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Arachtoids! Stop 'em!

Speaker: senator cunningham
Dialogue: Arachtoids?

Speaker: john bigboot
Dialogue: Okay, wise guys!

Speaker: john bigboot
Dialogue: Let those gun belts hit the floor! And nobody follows, or the prof is history!

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: Is this the kind of society you want?  A society of weak-kneed jellyfish wallowing in self-pity, prey to ruthless hoodlums who pick us off like flies?

Speaker: senator cunningham
Dialogue: Or a society where we stand strong, take charge of our own destiny, with the cry "So far and no farther will we be pushed!"

Speaker: exhibitor
Dialogue: Hey, you can't ride that!

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: Any sign of Buckaroo?

Speaker: reno
Dialogue: No!  Ditto the professor-

Speaker: rawhide
Dialogue: Shit!

Speaker: duck hunters
Dialogue: My God!  What the hell...

Speaker: duck hunters
Dialogue: Jesus Christ--!  What is it?

Speaker: john bigboot
Dialogue: A black thermopod here?  On Earth?!  Why, John Gomez?  Why?

Speaker: john gomez
Dialogue: John Whorfin...maybe they know he's escaped!

Speaker: john bigboot
Dialogue: They know everything!  I told Whorfin to sit tight.  This could be the end of us all!  We gotta get Banzai's Overthruster and get off this rock!

Speaker: john bigboot
Dialogue: Where was it, John O'Connor? How far back?

Speaker: john gomez
Dialogue: Death to the enemy!

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Rawhide.  Come in.  Over.

Speaker: rawhide
Dialogue: Over, Buckaroo.  What's up?  Where in Hades are you?  I'm getting a lotta static.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: That's me. I've been ionized, but I'm okay. I'm, switching on the homing beacon, mark two minute intervals.

Speaker: rawhide
Dialogue: Buckaroo, somebody shanghaied the Professor!

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: The deuce you say.  That crate!

Speaker: rawhide
Dialogue: What crate?

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: I think I'm on to something. You and the guys go back to the house and dig up everything you can on an outfit called Yoyodyne.

Speaker: rawhide
Dialogue: Yoyodyne Propulsion Systems?  You think they're mixed up in this?

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: How long you been riding with Buckaroo, Reno?

Speaker: reno
Dialogue: Nigh on ten years.  Been through a lotta scrapes together.

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: What'd you do before?  Can I ask?

Speaker: reno
Dialogue: Government work.  Had my own think tank.  Got tired of thinking-wanted some action.  Seen plenty of it too.  So will you if you stick around.

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: Where's Buckaroo?  Is he alive?

Speaker: reno
Dialogue: Course he's alive.  He's Buckaroo Banzai.

Speaker: rawhide
Dialogue: All right.  Let's go!  We got our work cut out for us tonight!

Speaker: rawhide
Dialogue: You, too, Miss Penny.

Speaker: john bigboot
Dialogue: No thanks, I'm driving.

Speaker: highway patrolman
Dialogue: Hand me that tarp. Let's cover this guy...

Speaker: john bigboot
Dialogue: John Bigboot, Officer. Executive Vice President, Yoyodyne Propulsion Systems.

Speaker: john gomez
Dialogue: One of our birds.

Speaker: highway patrolman
Dialogue: That fella over there-that one of yours, too, is it?

Speaker: john bigboot
Dialogue: The droid, you mean?

Speaker: highway patrolman
Dialogue: Looks like nothing I ever seen. I seen droids in space movies, but they're nothing like this-

Speaker: john gomez
Dialogue: It's a three-man thermopod...

Speaker: highway patrolman
Dialogue: Thermopod?  What's a...

Speaker: john bigboot
Dialogue: Very T.S.  Top Secret, right John Gomez?

Speaker: highway patrolman
Dialogue: Yeah, well, I was gonna call Buckaroo Banzai out here to have a look. Right up his alley, I think.

Speaker: john bigboot
Dialogue: You called Buckaroo Banzai?

Speaker: highway patrolman
Dialogue: Not yet.  I said I was gonna.

Speaker: highway patrolman
Dialogue: Go on!  Keep it moving!

Speaker: john gomez
Dialogue: We got a truck on the way to mop things up for you.  Else this place could become a zoo, not to mention a haven for gawkers.

Speaker: john bigboot
Dialogue: We'll just go ahead and start breaking it down.

Speaker: highway patrolman
Dialogue: Don't touch it!  I got my own help on the way!  That's an order!

Speaker: john bigboot
Dialogue: There's a crowbar in the truck.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Careful...don't make noise and don't touch me.  I'm hotter than flapjacks.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: I'm a giant semi-conductor, and there's alien creatures all around us. Form the Eighth Dimension, I think.  Look...

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Ever since that phony phone call from the President.  Look at this. What is it?

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: It's an antidote. A formula.  Whoever it was on the phone made me scribble this and gave me the ability to penetrate their disguises.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Arachtoids.  From Planet Ten.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: There's a Harley behind those bushes.  Get back to the laboratory and start working on the formula.  We don't have time to ask questions. Just synthesize it-

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Hurry!  Please.

Speaker: highway patrolman
Dialogue: If you're gonna stay, you're gonna be under arrest.  It's your choice.

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: Twelve minutes since the last signal. Long time.

Speaker: rawhide
Dialogue: Too long.  We better get somebody over there.  Put up the grid, last known location--

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: Done.

Speaker: john bigboot
Dialogue: Open it!

Speaker: scooter lindley
Dialogue: This is Scooter Lindley, Future Knight of the Blue Shield 411/2. Hang on!

Speaker: scooter lindley
Dialogue: Dad! Dad! Buckaroo's in trouble!

Speaker: casper lindley
Dialogue: Say what?!

Speaker: new jersey
Dialogue: Trouble?

Speaker: rawhide
Dialogue: Nah-Damn sophisticated equipment always breaking down.

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: What's his problem?

Speaker: reno
Dialogue: Perfect Tommy's just threatened by smart women.  Can you play that thing?

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: Better than him.

Speaker: highway patrolman
Dialogue: Whadda you think you're doing?  Hey!

Speaker: highway patrolman
Dialogue: I said back off!  I mean it.  Now get in your car and get the hell outta here!

Speaker: reno
Dialogue: She's not Peggy, Mrs. Johnson--

Speaker: rawhide
Dialogue: Any word from Buckaroo?

Speaker: brainy kid
Dialogue: Hi, fellas...gonna lay down some background vocals tonight?

Speaker: rawhide
Dialogue: Wish life was so simple, Billy.  Remember that outfit the Justice Department checked into last year-Yoyodyne Propulsion Systems?

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: You got her.  Buckaroo's orders: access their data bank.  Attack their systems.  Up to it?

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: I'm a little short-handed tonight.  My phone phreaks went into town for the big ice cream social...

Speaker: new jersey
Dialogue: So we'll help.  Let's get crackin'!

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Who're you?

Speaker: john gant
Dialogue: Detonator set.  My most profuse apologies to my homeland and loved ones.  John Valuk is dead.  He fell on his head, but perhaps John Parker will get through!

Speaker: highway patrolman
Dialogue: That's it, gentlemen, you're all under...

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Easy, friend-

Speaker: casper lindley
Dialogue: Forgive the butterfingers, Buckaroo.  Casper Lindley, Knight of the Blue Shield, at your disposal.  And my son, Scooter.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Nothing to apologize for, Casper.  You've gone beyond the call of duty tonight.  Mind if I get on the horn and radio the Cavaliers--?  They'll be worried.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Not the famous Scooter....?

Speaker: scooter lindley
Dialogue: Wow.  You know it.

Speaker: pinky carruthers
Dialogue: The prof just rolled in.  Says he's on his way to the lab and "Do not disturb."

Speaker: rawhide
Dialogue: Try a new cipher.  Try G.

Speaker: new jersey
Dialogue: Nice work, kid.

Speaker: reno
Dialogue: The professor just pulled in, jabbering something about space monsters, locked himself in his lab.

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: "Space monsters"...my ass.

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: What happened to her?

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: Any what?

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: What's up those stairs?

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: This is queer...look...

Speaker: new jersey
Dialogue: New Jersey?

Speaker: reno
Dialogue: Looks like none of these guys ever lived anywhere else.  No places of birth.  And all of them with the same first name: John.

Speaker: new jersey
Dialogue: November 1, thirty days have September, April, June, and November...when short February's done, all the rest have thirty-one. October 31st!  Halloween!  Don't you get it?  Orson Welles!

Speaker: new jersey
Dialogue: Halloween. 1938..."War of the Worlds"...that fake radio news broadcast that got everybody scared, thinking that real live Martians were landing in Grover's Mill, New Jersey!  But then it all just turned out to be a hoax.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Then that's it!

Speaker: reno
Dialogue: What's it?

Speaker: new jersey
Dialogue: Right!  Hoax my eye!

Speaker: reno
Dialogue: You mean--?  No!

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Yes!  Martians!  Right across the river in Grover's Mills!

Speaker: pinky carruthers
Dialogue: Hi, buddy, what can I do for ya?

Speaker: john parker
Dialogue: Buckaroo Banzai?

Speaker: pinky carruthers
Dialogue: You a messenger? What've you got here?

Speaker: john parker
Dialogue: I need see Buckaroo Banzai in person. My name is John Parker. Identify yourself.

Speaker: pinky carruthers
Dialogue: Knight Commander, Pinky Carruthers. Sorry, John, all these people "need see" Buckaroo in person.

Speaker: sudden voice
Dialogue: That's as far as you go, pal.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Okay, who's the funny guy?

Speaker: john bigboot
Dialogue: John Whorfin will kill us!

Speaker: john gomez
Dialogue: Professor Hikita!

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Is the professor here? Where's Penny?

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: What? How do you know that?

Speaker: rawhide
Dialogue: It's all on the record. Come on-

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Planet 10?  The same Planet 10 you postulated beyond Pluto, Perfect Tommy?  The invisible body?

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: Yeah, but most of 'em blasted in through the Eighth Dimension in 1938 at Grover's Mills, New Jersey...

Speaker: reno
Dialogue: ...where there was some kinda giant crash landing, a huge explosion and they fooled Orson Welles into covering it up!  And then they founded Yoyodyne Propulsion Systems and hid there for...

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Orson Wells?  What about Doctor Lizardo?

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: Lizardo caused it all.  Because he was already here on earth, screwing around with his own stupid Overthruster.

Speaker: rawhide
Dialogue: Faulty design.  It sucked.

Speaker: reno
Dialogue: ...but he wasn't the real Doctor Lizardo...just this arachtoid creep that stole the good doc's body the year before in the Eighth Dimension when Prof. Hikita's lab exploded...

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Stole his body?  When Doctor Lizardo's hair turned red and his mind snapped?  Of course!  What else?

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: It wouldn't tell us the whole story until you got here.  It wasn't to talk to the head honcho.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: It?  Who does?

Speaker: hologram
Dialogue: Salutations, great Buckaroo Banzai.  I am John Emdall from Planet 10. A common grave danger confronts both our worlds.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Will everybody please shut up so I can hear this thing?

Speaker: pinky carruthers
Dialogue: "John Parker" I think he called himself, this Rasta man on a bike dressed up in aluminum foil.  With a weird album...how the hell was I supposed to know he came from outer space?

Speaker: john emdall
Dialogue: And now, you, Buckaroo Banzai, have unintentionally helped John Whorfin further with your Oscillation Overthruster! For our intelligence warns us that John Whorfin is about to make good his escape from Earth back through the Eighth Dimension...and on to Planet 10! If he should attempt this we will have no choice but to disrupt worldwide electronic communications and fire a particle beam weapon from your airspace to Smolensk, in the Union of the Soviet Socialist Republics.

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: An action the Kremlin will most certainly misinterpret as an American first strike!

Speaker: john emdall
Dialogue: Exactly, Perfect Tommy.  The Soviets will retaliate.  Your President Widmark will launch a massive counterforce strike...and within twenty minutes the danger to Planet 10 will be removed...

Speaker: reno
Dialogue: God, if it's not one thing it's another.

Speaker: john emdall
Dialogue: But...because we're good guys, we're giving you a chance to save your planet.  Stop John Whorfin before sunrise! If you fail we will be forced to help you destroy yourselves.  End of discussion.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: You wanna take the chance, Casper?

Speaker: casper lindley
Dialogue: Not me. No way.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Rawhide, go find out how Professor Hikita's coming with that formula. Mrs. Johnson, take Casper and Scooter, gas up the Jet Car.

Speaker: scooter lindley
Dialogue: Wow, you know it!

Speaker: reno
Dialogue: Where're you goin'?

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: To get my guns.

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: His guns?  Holy shit.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Open up or I'll shoot it off.

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: I'll shoot yours off if I had a gun, you double-dealing Casanova!  I thought you liked me for myself.  But why should you, huh?  A jerk like me.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Penny, look-

Speaker: penny's voice
Dialogue: You look.  Who is she?

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: That's kinda complicated to get into right now because the world's maybe coming to an end and I can't stand here and talk to a closet door.

Speaker: penny's voice
Dialogue: Yeah, whose world is coming to an end?  You only wanted me because I remind you of her.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Penny, I was going to get into that, but I haven't had time...with arachtoids and all...but briefly she was your long lost twin sister, we got married, and that's about all I can say.  Right now.  Penny?

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: Married--?  So that's it!  Buckaroo Banzai, a married man.  Where is she?  With the kids some place?

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: She must've been a bigger fool than me if she ran out on a guy like you...

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: She was killed, Penny.

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: Oh, my.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Don't go to pieces.  I haven't got time tonight.

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: Looks like you're the one might go to pieces.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Where's my damn ammo?  Nothing is ever where it's supposed to be around here!

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: How did she die?  I wanna know.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: You don't wanna know.

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: Yes, I do.  Gimme a chance.  I'm stronger than you think.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: She was murdered by Hanoi Shan on our wedding night.

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: Hanoi Shan--?  The guy in your comic books.  Boss of the World Crime League?  Supreme Commander of the Legion of Death?  The Pivot of Mystery himself?  You're putting me on.  He's a cartoon character.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: I wish he was.  He's real enough.

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: God, she's so young and beautiful.  I don't remember her at all.  Which I guess is good, under the circumstances.  I bet you'll never forget her though.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Never.

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: I gotta be honest with myself and not repress these feelings-I've got mixed emotions-I don't know if I can handle this.  Oh, boy...

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: I gotta go.  We're on borrowed time.

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: Go where?  Where're you going?

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Please, Penny.  You just gotta trust me now.  Okay?  And don't panic. Because it's gonna be all right.

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: What?  If we just believe in Buckaroo Banzai?

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Yeah...and maybe more important, if you believe in yourself.

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: Believe in Penny Priddy?

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Absolutely.

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: You've got your six guns strapped on.  You're ridding off on another adventure?  Oh, my God, it's all real...it really is real.  I should go with you.  Please...

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: It's too dangerous.

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: That's just what you would say.  This is so unreal.  I'm dreaming...

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: Buckaroo--! Sorry--

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: What is it, Tommy?

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: Sam's dead!  Someone broke into the Jet Car! And things are going haywire over at the lab...

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Stay here, I'll be back.

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: Sure.  I won't hold my breath.

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: Whadda you want?

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Dead.  Damnit!

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: Where's the professor?

Speaker: reno
Dialogue: Where's Rawhide?

Speaker: casper
Dialogue: Who'd do a thing like this?

Speaker: new jersey
Dialogue: Arachtoids.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Spread out. They can't be far.

Speaker: rawhide
Dialogue: Look out, Buckaroo!

Speaker: rawhide
Dialogue: Behind you!

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: You okay?

Speaker: rawhide
Dialogue: Yeah. Just grazed me.  The Professor's under the floor too...with the Overthruster...

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Professor--!?

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: Buckaroo!  Rawhide!  Reno?  Anybody?

Speaker: rawhide
Dialogue: You're a welcome sight...

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Just 'grazed' you, huh?

Speaker: rawhide
Dialogue: Apache?

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Arachtoid.

Speaker: rawhide
Dialogue: So I was right.  That's nice to know...

Speaker: pinky carruthers
Dialogue: We found the guy, Rawhide, sucker dug a hole and tried to...

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Any antidote for these things?

Speaker: john parker
Dialogue: No, none.

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: That mean you're on our side?

Speaker: rawhide
Dialogue: We gotta stop 'em, Buckaroo.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: We will, old fried, we will.

Speaker: rawhide
Dialogue: Sure do pack a mean wallop...let's go...

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: There's another one we owe 'em.

Speaker: casper lindley
Dialogue: They're stealing my chopper!

Speaker: reno
Dialogue: And they got Penny!  Look!

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Don't shoot!

Speaker: john parker
Dialogue: Then your planet is doomed.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: No!  We'll get it back.

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: These'll make you a tenny bit drowsy, Mr. President.

Speaker: president widmark
Dialogue: That's okay, Bonnie, I won't be operating any heavy machinery today.

Speaker: president widmark
Dialogue: As are all sane men today.

Speaker: president widmark
Dialogue: World Watch One.  Direct incoming transmission.

Speaker: president widmark
Dialogue: That which does not kill us makes us stronger, Buckaroo.  What's it like out there in the real world?

Speaker: president widmark
Dialogue: You're gonna have to repeat that, I think, Buckaroo.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: To cut right to the bottom line on this, sir, we have reason to believe that there are moving freely among us, vicious red aliens disguised as the owners and operators of Yoyodyne Propulsion Systems.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: The gentleman standing here with me is called John Parker, and he can corroborate everything I've said because he's from Planet 10 too.

Speaker: president widmark
Dialogue: Buckaroo...you and I, we go back a long, long way together...but...

Speaker: president widmark
Dialogue: Explosive? What are you saying, man? Some kind of race war in New Jersey--?

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: No, sir.  This 'man' as you call him, is not a human being, Mr. President.  He's a black arachtoid.

Speaker: president widmark
Dialogue: A what?

Speaker: president widmark
Dialogue: You're quite serious about this, aren't you, Buckaroo.  We know each other pretty well, I think.

Speaker: new jersey
Dialogue: There's your answer!  Electromagnetic bacterial crap!

Speaker: new jersey
Dialogue: We inhale the bacteria.  It swims to our cerebral cortex and reprograms our consciousness.  Diabolical.  We only see what they want us to see.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: I've got it, Mr. Secretary.  But unfortunately the Oscillation Overthruster is in Penny Priddy's possession and she's been kidnapped and taken to Yoyodyne, further exacerbating the situation. We're on our way there right now.

Speaker: president widmark
Dialogue: Who the hell's Penny Priddy?

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: Buckaroo, John Parker has the arachtoid cloud on line 2!

Speaker: president widmark
Dialogue: Good God...

Speaker: president widmark
Dialogue: Get me SAC HQ: Omaha, NORAD, and the Strategic Space Command. I want some hard data on that cloud. We got any killer satellites over Jersey- -?

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: John Parker, tell them we're doing our best.  Stall.

Speaker: john parker
Dialogue: Buckaroo Banzai says patience is a virtue, Wing Commander, sir.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Whorfin?  Does he know we're coming?

Speaker: doctor lizardo
Dialogue: Well, well...Dr. Banzai. Perhaps you don't remember me?  Ah, I'm flattered.  We know the same people.  In fact, one of them is here with me now...your associate, Doctor Penny Priddy.

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: I'm not worth it, Buckaroo! Forget me!

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Penny--?!  Are you all right?

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: She knows nothing, Lizardo.

Speaker: doctor lizardo
Dialogue: Then shall we say "A Penny for your thoughts?" You can come in her place. Yoyodyne, Dr. Banzai. Come alone, with your Overthruster!  He'll bring it.  I know his type.

Speaker: doctor lizardo
Dialogue: Take her to the pit!  Use more honey.  Find out what she knows.

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: Who are you?  Hanoi Shan?  The Scourge of Burma!  The Pivot of Mystery? Well, you're not destroying me like you did my sister!

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: These antidote filters the Professor's whipped up will let you to see them like I have since yesterday, as arachtoidal creatures. They won't be pretty, nothing personal, John Parker.  But just remember...if we fail tonight, there's no tomorrow.

Speaker: john parker
Dialogue: They will never surrender.  They will fight to the end.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: I'm working under the assumption that Penny still has the Overthruster. That'll be my job: get it back in one piece.  Here's the main gate. I'll pass through first, alone.  The rest of you divide into two strike groups-Apache Team...that's you, Reno...and Chaparral Team, Perfect Tommy.  John Parker'll ride with Chaparral.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Top priority is the Overthruster. Whorfin can't escape without it. The built-in tracking device should make it relatively simple to locate...maybe hard to get.

Speaker: president widmark
Dialogue: What's happening with my call to SAC?

Speaker: president widmark
Dialogue: Jammed--? By who? Whom by?

Speaker: president widmark
Dialogue: Should we be on Code Red?

Speaker: general catburd
Dialogue: We go to Code Red, the Russians go to Code Red...no sense jumping off half-cocked, Mr. President.

Speaker: senator cunningham
Dialogue: I don't know...Buckaroo Banzai's never been wrong before.

Speaker: general catburd
Dialogue: The man went through solid matter, for crying out loud. Who knows what it did to his brain...maybe scrambled his molecules. All I'm saying is, let's not panic here!  I'm sure there's a rational explanation...

Speaker: president widmark
Dialogue: We've got no choice then.  Call my wife.

Speaker: general catburd
Dialogue: Mr. President, none of us here are lunatics or irrational men...  ...or persons.  I'm a soldier and I'm a damn good one, enough decorations to snap a Christmas tree, but I don't mind telling you, I'm sure I speak for everyone in this room when I say I am scared. I'm barely holding my fudge right now.

Speaker: senator cunningham
Dialogue: Stop acting like a goddamn schoolgirl, General, and pull yourself together.

Speaker: president widmark
Dialogue: I'm glad someone has the balls to face facts!  Forget we're the good guys and we'd never attack first.  They think we're godless monsters just like them.  Put yourself in their samovars...sitting in the dark without radar, bells ringing all over the damn Kremlin, little men in fedora hats getting out of Zils, coming into the Great Hall of the People.  Now, do you think they're gonna listen to reason?  I'll give Buckaroo his Planet 10 space cloud, but do you think they will?

Speaker: general catburd
Dialogue: Hail Mary.

Speaker: president widmark
Dialogue: So what's our counter option, General Catburd?  Earn your salary.

Speaker: general catburd
Dialogue: I guess we have to prick this boil and take the heat, sir.  Hit 'em primero...blast 'em off the face of the Earth before they lose their heads and do it to us first.

Speaker: president widmark
Dialogue: Larry, where's my Football?

Speaker: general catburd
Dialogue: What're you waiting for, boy?  Get in here with that thing.

Speaker: reno
Dialogue: We're waiting for the Jet Car.  Billy's bringing it.

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: Asshole probably got lost.

Speaker: new jersey
Dialogue: Or nailed for speeding.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Can I have everyone's attention?  I'm not a rah-rah kinda guy, and I'm not much for speeches, but things could get rough out there tonight. It's a fight we didn't ask for, but it's a fight we're stuck with and we all saw what happened to Rawhide.  So if for any reason this is good-bye, I want you all to know that...well...that...you crazy lugs...

Speaker: reno
Dialogue: What, Buckaroo?  You trying to tell us something?

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Let's just fry those arachtoids.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Give me thirty minutes.  Then come in and mop up.

Speaker: president widmark
Dialogue: Well... that's certainly food for thought.

Speaker: general catburd
Dialogue: Here you go, Mr. President...the Sealed Authenticators.  The Plan D Documents for your eyes only...John-Hancock these, and we got ourselves a knockout little force posture...

Speaker: senator cunningham
Dialogue: You know, on second thought, maybe we should think this through a bit more so that future generations of...

Speaker: president widmark
Dialogue: "Name of the enemy"?  What, Planet 10?  My hand's shaking.  How on earth can I even...have to stay awake, alert...that's my job.  That's what the people put me here for.

Speaker: doctor lizardo
Dialogue: Blacks are on this planet! Here in New Jersey! Coming to destroy us! We must move! Escape or die!

Speaker: doctor lizardo
Dialogue: You must work faster to finish the Great Vehicle. So that we can enter the Eighth Dimension and free our trapped comrades! So we can return to our homeland and seize power once again!

Speaker: red arachtoids
Dialogue: To Planet 10!

Speaker: red arachtoids
Dialogue: Real soon!

Speaker: john gomez
Dialogue: Not here!

Speaker: doctor lizardo
Dialogue: WHERE IS THE OVERTHRUSTER!

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: I thought you had it!

Speaker: doctor lizardo
Dialogue: Solve them! The shock tower is a lie detector. Any untruth triggers a brutal charge to your auditory meatus...

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: You're not getting a damn thing outta me until Penny's safe.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: I've got nothing but time.

Speaker: doctor lizardo
Dialogue: Sealed with a curse as sharp as a knife...doomed is your soul, and damned is your life!

Speaker: doctor lizardo
Dialogue: I want my missing circuit now!

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: You bloody--!

Speaker: doctor lizardo
Dialogue: She'll live...for a while, and she won't enjoy it.

Speaker: doctor lizardo
Dialogue: Only you can save her from the fate of your friend, Mr. Rawhide!  Solve this equation.  I must have the crucial missing circuit.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: The missing circuit's in your head, Whorfin.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: John Emdall told me.

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: Light precipitation.  Partly cloudy tomorrow.

Speaker: scooter lindley
Dialogue: Could I have your autograph, Mr. Parker?

Speaker: scooter lindley
Dialogue: Say, "To my best friend Scooter..."

Speaker: john parker
Dialogue: You got it.

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: Not on this bus, you're not.

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: Perfect Tommy.

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: Go ahead, Louie, do like the man says.

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: Hey, so we get into action quicker this way.  We tell Buckaroo our watches were fast.

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: It's Bigboot.

Speaker: john parker
Dialogue: Under here, I think.

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: Under where?  Hold on...

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: Hope you know where you're going, John Parker.  Because my nose is starting to whistle...

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: Thanks.

Speaker: john parker
Dialogue: Don't mention it.

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: Then I won't.

Speaker: john parker
Dialogue: They sense us.  Hurry.

Speaker: doctor lizardo
Dialogue: Stop him!  Get him!

Speaker: doctor lizardo
Dialogue: Kill the girl!

Speaker: john bigboot
Dialogue: That's 'Bigboot'.

Speaker: john bigboot
Dialogue: It's not my goddamn planet!  Understand, monkey boy!?

Speaker: john bigboot
Dialogue: Damn John Whorfin--!

Speaker: john parker
Dialogue: Look out, Buckaroo Banzai!

Speaker: new jersey
Dialogue: Leave her to me. You take care of business.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Thanks.

Speaker: doctor lizardo
Dialogue: Sound the call to board ship!

Speaker: john bigboot
Dialogue: Without the crucial missing circuit?  We'll never make it!

Speaker: doctor lizardo
Dialogue: You heard my orders!  Activate the Special Horns!

Speaker: doctor lizardo
Dialogue: Massacre them! Without quarter!

Speaker: doctor lizardo
Dialogue: Close the doors!

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: What is this thing?  A fighter?

Speaker: john parker
Dialogue: Don't look at me, Buckaroo Banzai.  I failed flight school.

Speaker: doctor lizardo
Dialogue: Overthruster in place.

Speaker: john bigboot
Dialogue: It won't work! It won't!

Speaker: doctor lizardo
Dialogue: Shut up, John Bigboote, you coward!

Speaker: doctor lizardo
Dialogue: Again, John O'Connor!  Again!

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: They haven't got enough power.  They'll never penetrate!

Speaker: doctor lizardo
Dialogue: Almost!  Almost!  Lower my vehicle onto the runway!

Speaker: john bigboot
Dialogue: No!  Please!

Speaker: john parker
Dialogue: We're going down!  Onto the runway!

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: The door's locked.

Speaker: small voice
Dialogue: Another step, I'll drink your blood--!

Speaker: scooter lindley
Dialogue: Get 'em up!

Speaker: scooter lindley
Dialogue: What's that?

Speaker: john bigtoote
Dialogue: We haven't a chance.  Your Overthruster's for shit!  We'll all just...

Speaker: john whorfin
Dialogue: One more word out of you, Bigboote...

Speaker: john bigtoote
Dialogue: Bigboot.

Speaker: whorfin's voice
Dialogue: Full speed ahead!  Battle stations!

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Tell them to stop.  They're your friends!

Speaker: john parker
Dialogue: I lack the authority, Buckaroo Banzai.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: At least tell them I'm trying!  Tell 'em something--!

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Does this thing have guns, John Parker?

Speaker: john parker
Dialogue: Boy, I hope so, Buckaroo Banzai.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Take the throttle, John Parker!

Speaker: john whorfin
Dialogue: Banzai!  I'll see you in hell!

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Pull up!  We did it!  Holy shit, we did it!  Pull up!

Speaker: john parker
Dialogue: Now, Buckaroo Banzai?

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Now!

Speaker: doctor lizardo
Dialogue: Toichi--?  I'll be damned.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: All accounted for?  Where's Penny?

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: New Jersey brought her back to the bus through heavy fire.  Quite a guy if you want my opinion.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Got a casualty list?

Speaker: reno
Dialogue: Just their side.  What're we gonna do with these people?  They're illegal aliens, the way I figure, been here forty years, you could throw the book at 'em...

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: And ask the American taxpayer to foot the bill?  No way.  Send 'em back to the Eighth Dimension as soon as we find the Overthruster.  It wasn't in Penny's purse...so if we have to run this joint upside down and inside out...

Speaker: perfect tommy
Dialogue: Hey, Scooter Lindley, fall in!

Speaker: scooter lindley
Dialogue: Is this what you're looking for, Buckaroo?

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Looks like one Junior Shield is in line for a ride in The Jet Car.

Speaker: scooter lindley
Dialogue: Wow, you know it!  I'll have to ask my dad.

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Well, go ahead, what're you waiting for?

Speaker: new jersey
Dialogue: I did all I could.  I did my best...

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Tell him yes on "1" and no on "2".

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Penny!

Speaker: buckaroo banzai
Dialogue: Open your eyes!  Look at me!  Penny!

Speaker: penny priddy
Dialogue: Buckaroo...you look awful.
